gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਬਹੁਤ ਬਰਖ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨ ॥ ਚੜਿ ਮੇਰ ਸ੍ਰਿੰਗ ਮਹਾਨ ॥ ਕੀਅ ਘੋਰ ਤਪਸਾ ੳੁਗ੍ਰ ॥ ਤਬ ਰੀਝੲੇ ਕਛੁ ਸੁਗ੍ਰ ॥੪੭੪॥
transliteration: Tab Bahout Barakh Pramaan|| Char(i) Mer Sring Mahaan|| Keea Ghor Tapsaa Ougra|| Tab Reejhae Kachh(u) Sougra||474||
translation: Then ascending the Sumeru mountain the sage performed great austerities for many years and felt pleased as the essence-finder.474.

gurmukhi: ਜਗ ਦੇਖ ਕੈ ਬਿਵਹਾਰ ॥ ਮੁਨ ਰਾਜ ਕੀਨ ਬਿਚਾਰ ॥ ੲਿਨ ਕੳੁਨ ਸੋ ੳੁਪਜਾੲਿ ॥ ਫਿਰਿ ਲੇਤ ਅਾਪ ਮਿਲਾੲਿ ॥੪੭੫॥
transliteration: Jag Dekh Kai Bivhaar|| Mounndraaj Keen Bichaar|| In Kaoun So Oupjaae|| Phir(i) Let Aap Milaae||475||
translation: Seeing the practice of the world, the sage thought as to who is He, who creates the world and then merges it within Himself?475.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹ ਚੀਨੀਅੈ ਕਰਿ ਗਿਅਾਨ ॥ ਤਬ ਹੋੲਿ ਪੂਰਣ ਧਯਾਨ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਜਤ ਜੋਗ ॥ ਤਬ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੇਹ ਅਰੋਗ ॥੪੭੬॥
transliteration: Tih Cheeneeai Kar(i) Giaan|| Tab Hoe Pooran Dhyaan|| Tih Jaaneeai Jat Jog|| Tah Hoe Dehdarog||476||
translation: When He is recognized through the knowledge, then the adoration will be complete; if He is comprehended through the medium off Yoga, only then the body (and the mind) will be completely healthy.476.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ੲੇਕ ਪੁਰਖ ਪਛਾਨ ॥ ਜਗ ਨਾਸ ਜਾਹਿਨ ਜਾਨ ॥ ਸਤ ਜਗਤ ਕੋ ਪਤਿ ਦੇਖ ॥ ਅਨਭੳੁ ਅਨੰਤ ਅਭੇਖ ॥੪੭੭॥
transliteration: Tab Ek Puralh Pachhaad|| Jag Naas Jaahin Jaan|| Sat Jagad Ko Pat(i) Dekh|| Anbhau Anant Abhekh||477||
translation: Then the supreme essence will be known (when it will be realized) that He is also the destroyer of the world; that master of the world is real and Lord is supremely absorbed and He is also beyond all forms.477.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਨਾਹਿਨ ਸ਼ਾਂਤਿ ॥ ਸਭ ਤੀਰਥ ਕਿਯੁੰ ਨ ਅਨ੍ਹਾਤ ॥ ਜਬ ਸੇਵਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਕਿ ਨਾਮ ॥ ਤਬ ਹੋੲਿ ਪੂਰਣ ਕਾਮ ॥੪੭੮॥
transliteration: Bin Ek Naahin Shaant(i)|| Sabh Teerath Kiyoun Na Anahaat|| Jab Sev(i) Hoe Kinaam|| Tab Hoe Pooran Kaam||478||
translation: There will be no peace without that one Lord; the bath at all the pilgrim-stations will be fruitless; when service will be rendered to him and His Name will be remembered, then all the desires will be fulfilled.478.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਚੌਬਿਸ ਫੋਕ ॥ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਧਰਾ ਸਭ ਲੋਕ ॥ ਜਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਕੳੁ ਪਹਿਚਾਨ ॥ ਤਿਨ ਚੳੁਬਿਸੋ ਰਸ ਮਾਨ ॥੪੭੯॥
transliteration: Bin Ek Chaoubis Phok|| Sabh Hidharaa Sabh Lok|| Jin Ek Kau Paihchaan|| Tin Chaoubiso Ras Maan||479||
translation: Without that One Lord, all the twenty-four incarnation and all others are meaningless; he, who recognizes the One Lord, he will remain jubilant even on adoring all the twenty-four incarnations.479.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ੲੇਕ ਕੇ ਰਸ ਭੀਨ ॥ ਤਿਨ ਚੳੁਬਿਸੋ ਰਸ ਲੀਨ ॥ ਜਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਕੋ ਨਹੀ ਬੂਝ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਚੳੁਬਿਸੈ ਰਸ ਮਾਨ ॥੪੮੦॥
transliteration: Je Ek Ke As Bheen|| Tin Chaoubiso Ras Leen|| Jin Ek Jo Nahiboodhe|| Tih Chaoubisai Nahisoojh||480||
translation: He, who falls in love with the One Lord, he will feel happy in knowing about the wonderful works of all the twenty-four incarnations; he, who does not recognize the One Lord, he cannot know the mysteries of the twenty-four incarnations.480.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਕੌ ਨਹੀ ਚੀਨ ॥ ਤਿਨ ਚੳੁਬਿਸੈ ਫਲ ਹੀਨ ॥ ਜਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਕੋ ਪਹਿਚਾਨ ॥ ਤਿਨ ਚੳੁਬਿਸੈ ਰਸ ਮਾਨ ॥੪੮੧॥
transliteration: Jin Ek Kau Nahicheen|| Tin Chaoubisai Phal Heen|| Jin Ek Ko Paihchaan|| Tin Chaoubisai Ras Maan||481||
translation: He, who not recognized the One Lord, the twenty-four are fruitless for him; he, who feels the presence of One and recognizes him, he can feel the happiness of the twenty-four.481.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕਹਿ ਜੳੁ ਮਨ ਅਾਨਾ ॥ ਦੂਸਰ ਭਾਵ ਨ ਜਾਨਾ ॥ ਦੁੰਦਭ ਦੳੁਰ ਬਜਾੲੇ ॥ ਫੂਲ ਸੁਰਨ ਬਰਖਾੲੇ ॥੪੮੨॥
transliteration: Ekah(i) Jau Man Aanaa|| Doosar Bhaav Na Jaanaa|| Doundabh Daur Bajaae|| Phool Suran Barkhaae||482||
translation: The sage absorbed his mind in the One Lord and did not allow any other idea to enter his mind, then the gods showered flowers, beating their drums.482.

gurmukhi: ਹਰਖੈ ਸਭ ਜਟ ਧਾਰੀ ॥ ਗਾਵਤ ਦੇਦੇ ਤਾਰੀ ॥ ਜਿਤ ਤਿਤ ਡੋਲਤ ਫੂਲੇ ॥ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਕੇ ਸਭ ਦੁਖ ਭੂਲੇ ॥੪੮੩॥
transliteration: Harkhai Sabh Jat Dhdaree|| Gadvat Dede Tdaree|| Jit Tit Dolat Phoole|| Grah(i) Ke Sabh Doukh Bhoole||483||
translation: The sages, getting delighted, clapped their hands and began to sing; they forgot their domestic worries and moved here and there happily.483.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਬਰਖ ਜਬੈ ਤਪਸਾ ਤਿਹ ਕੀਨੀ ॥ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਕ੍ਰਿਅਾ ਜੁ ਕਹੀ ਧਰ ਲੀਨੀ ॥
transliteration: Bahu Barakh Jabai Tapsaa Tih Keenee|| Gurdev Kriaa Ju Kahidhar Linee||
translation: In this way, when the sages performed austerities for many years and did all according to the bidding of their Guru;
